chart_metadata.name: prometheus
chart_metadata.description: The Prometheus monitoring system and time series database.

runAsContext.description: Prometheus can run as any non-root user.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Prometheus

attrs.label: Retention Time
attrs.description: The time to retain data for. Use the format 15d, 6w, 10y, etc.

attrs.label: Retention Size
attrs.description: The size to retain data for. Use the format 100MB, 10GB, etc.

attrs.label: WAL Compression
attrs.description: Compress the time series database write-ahead log.

attrs.label: Additional Arguments
attrs.description: Configure additional arguments for Prometheus.

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Prometheus.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Prometheus will run as.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Prometheus will run as.

attrs.label: API Port
attrs.description: The port for the Prometheus API (And WebUI).

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.

attrs.label: Prometheus Data Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Prometheus data/metrics.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for Prometheus.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for Prometheus.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.1.15.app_readme:
Prometheus

Prometheus - Monitoring system and time series database.

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the prometheus directories. Afterward, the prometheus container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). Also an empty configuration file will be created.

The configuration file is located at /config/prometheus.yml inside the container. Data is stored at /data inside the container.
1.1.15.detailed_readme:
Prometheus

Prometheus - Monitoring system and time series database.

When application is installed, a container will be launched with root privileges. This is required in order to apply the correct permissions to the prometheus directories. Afterward, the prometheus container will run as a non-root user (Default: 568). Also an empty configuration file will be created.

The configuration file is located at /config/prometheus.yml inside the container. Data is stored at /data inside the container.
